description: The file system in the hda1 directory has errors.

event.Summary: File system in HDAL directory error detected

description: The hwEntityEnvTemperatureThresholdNotification
indicates the temperature have been exceed the threshold.
In the condition, user should check the hardware and the
environment of the entity, sometimes it happened because
of the failture of air-condition. Anyway, the threshold
should lower than the value that most service work fine.

event.Summary: Entity temperature $v1 exceeded threshold ($v2)

description: This object indicates the entity temperature.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityTemperature

description: This object indicates the upper threshold of the entity temperature.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityTemperatureThreshold

description: This object indicates the entity management status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAdminStatus

description: This object indicates the entity alarm status, which is consistent with the entity alarm indicator status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAlarmLight

description: The hwEntityExtVoltageLowThresholdNotification indicates
the voltage is lower than the threshold. This may decrease
the usability of the entity. If the voltage is lower too much
than the hardware needed, the entity will stop working.
Anyway, the threshold should higher than the value that
most service work fine.

event.Summary: Entity voltage $v1 lower than threshold ($v2)

description: This object indicates the entity voltage.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityVoltage

description: This object indicates the minimum entity voltage threshold.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityVoltageLowThreshold

description: This object indicates the entity management status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAdminStatus

description: This object indicates the entity alarm status, which is consistent with the entity alarm indicator status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAlarmLight

description: The hwEntityExtVoltageHighThresholdNotification indicates
the voltage is higher than the threshold. This may decrease
the usability of the entity. If the voltage is higher too much
than the hardware needed, the entity may be destroyed by the high
voltage. Anyway, the threshold should lower than the value
that most service work fine.

event.Summary: Entity voltage $v1 exceeded high voltage threshold ($v2)

description: This object indicates the entity voltage.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityVoltage

description: This object indicates the maximum entity voltage threshold.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityVoltageHighThreshold

description: This object indicates the entity management status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAdminStatus

description: This object indicates the entity alarm status, which is consistent with the entity alarm indicator status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityAlarmLight

description: The hwEntityExtCpuUsageThresholdNotfication indicates
the entity is overload, and the service running in the entity
will not get the performance it should because of CPU's
performance. Anyway, the threshold should lower than the
value that most service work fine.

event.Summary: CPU usage $v1 exceeded threshold ($v2)

description: Board software version incompatible with basic software version.

event.Summary: Board software version ($v3) incompatible with base version ($v2)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwBoardSoftwareVersionIncompatible ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityExtTrapBaseSoftwareVersion s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityExtTrapBoardSoftwareVersion s EXAMPLE

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: System bassic software version.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityExtTrapBaseSoftwareVersion

description: Board software version compare to basic software version.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityExtTrapBoardSoftwareVersion

description: When the split ports exist on the board, send a SNMP trap to network manager.

event.Summary: Split ports exist on board

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `console' or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number), such as `1', depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwPhysicalName

description: When the input usage of channel is more than the threshold of alarm, send a SNMP trap to network manager.

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: An indication of the general hardware type of the physical
entity.
An agent should set this object to the standard enumeration
value that most accurately indicates the general class of
the physical entity, or the primary class if there is more
than one entity.
If no appropriate standard registration identifier exists
for this physical entity, then the value 'other(1)' is
returned. If the value is unknown by this agent, then the
value 'unknown(2)' is returned.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalClass

description: This object indicates the entity operation status.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwEntityOperStatus

description: When the CRC errors of HIG port are more than the threshold, send a SNMP trap to network manager.

event.Summary: CRC errors of HIG port $v3 exceeded threshold ($v6)

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: This object indicates the change of the 'hardware capability file'. An alarm is generated if the sequence number of the 'hardware capability file' in the current startup file is different from that in the last startup file.

event.Summary: Sequence number ($v1) of hardware capability file mismatched

description: This object indicates the sequence number of the 'hardware capability file'.The value consists of the file version number and CRC code.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwHardwareCapaSequenceNo

description: This object indicates the change of the 'alarm capability file'. An alarm is generated if the sequence number of the 'alarm capability file' in the current startup file is different from that in the last startup file.

event.Summary: Sequence number ($v1) of alarm capability file mismatched

description: This object indicates the sequence number of the 'alarm capability file'.The value consists of the file version number and CRC code.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwAlarmPnPSequenceNo

description: Heartbeat trap.

event.Summary: Heartbeat trap

description: This object indicates the type of the inserted entity is different from that of pre-disposed entity on the slot.

event.Summary: Inserted entity differs from pre-disposed ($v2) on slot

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwDisposeEntPhysicalIndex

description: An indication of the vendor-specific hardware type of the
predisposed physical entity.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwDisposeEntPhysicalVendorType

description: An indication of the vendor-specific hardware type of the
physical entity. Note that this is different from the
definition of MIB-II's sysObjectID.
An agent should set this object to an enterprise-specific
registration identifier value indicating the specific
equipment type in detail. The associated instance of
entPhysicalClass is used to indicate the general type of
hardware device.
If no vendor-specific registration identifier exists for
this physical entity, or the value is unknown by this agent
then the value { 0 0 } is returned.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalVendorType

description: This object indicates the change of the 'predispose capability file'. An alarm is generated if the sequence number of the 'predispose capability file' in the current startup file is different from that in the last startup file.

event.Summary: Sequence number ($v1) of predispose capability file mismatched

description: This object indicates the sequence number of the 'predispose capability file'.The value consists of the file version number and CRC code.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB::hwPreDisposeSequenceNo

description: Board become unconnected for some reason.

event.Summary: Board disconnected

description: The index for this entry.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalIndex

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: Board resume from unconnected

event.Summary: Board connected
